result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Kyle J. Ryckman in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Kyle J. Ryckman in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Written waiver of preliminary hearing hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed. Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Kyle J. Ryckman in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Kyle J. Ryckman in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $5,000.00 signature bond; booking; no possession  or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No objection by Attorney Goetz.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.    Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  - rt

Taylor County Arrest Report

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances with out a valid prescription.

DAR started at 10:02:43.  Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $5,000.00 cash bond with conditions of:  Booking and defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for September 8, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. DAR stopped at 10:07:07. ba
